about_the_game:
Woodrow the Old Piano is a novelty musical toy and MIDI player, using real sounds from a distressed antique piano. You can play this virtual piano using PC keys or a MIDI input device (such as a digital piano) or load in MIDI files to be automatically played pianola-style.

Based on a real upright piano from the 1910s which has been sampled and remade in 3D, Woodrow the Old Piano is an out of tune piano simulator that resonates distressed, ragged sounds. Now you too can experience the ear-piercing noises of an out-of-shape antique piano without the inconvenience of stealing one from a haunted house.

Woodrow the Old Piano is a standalone musical toy, and not a plugin. Simply open it and enjoy! It's a fun virtual instrument to experiment with, and a charming gift for your musical friends.

  • Play up to 85 keys from a real old-timey piano using your computer keyboard or a MIDI keyboard controller

  • Load in MIDI files for automated playback, pianola-style

  • Features custom-made samples using real recordings from a distressed antique piano

  • Supports sustain pedal (on/off) and velocity sensitivity (key volume)

  • 3D piano keys and pedal react as you press them

  • Adjust crispness and tune using Key Blend slider

  • Complete Steam achievements to prove your mastery of this old timer

name: Woodrow the Old Piano

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: Intel i5 or Ryzen 5 (quad core recommended)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel UHD 630
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 400 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Minimum supported resolution of 1366x768. Support for MIDI input features may vary depending on device used.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Woodrow the Old Piano is a novelty musical toy and MIDI player, using real sounds from a distressed antique piano. Connect a keyboard controller or use your PC keys to play, or load in MIDI files for pianola-style playback, and enjoy the ear-piercing noises of this out-of-tune relic!
